sentences.en: a sense of community and social cohesion
sentences.cn: 社区意识和社会凝聚力

sentences.en: According to the currently accepted cohesion - tension theory, water is pulled there.
sentences.cn: 根据目前为人们所接受的内聚压力的理论, 水是被拉到上面去的.

sentences.en: Both cohesion and thematic progression play important roles in discourse coherence.
sentences.cn: 衔接与主位推进都对语篇的连贯起着重要作用,但其作用的发挥必须以话题相关为前提.

sentences.en: By 1990, it was clear that the cohesion of the armed forces was rapidly breaking down.
sentences.cn: 显然，到1990年时，武装部队的凝聚力正迅速瓦解。

sentences.en: Film processing operation of cohesion depends on laminated Binder for performance.
sentences.cn: 薄膜层加工操作过程中的粘接力取决于层合粘结剂的性能.

sentences.en: Group cohesion force and cooperative performance are two indexes of group evaluation.
sentences.cn: 协作组评价包括内聚力和协作绩效等两个指标.

sentences.en: I had to bring cohesion and unity into the company.
sentences.cn: 我得加强公司的团结和统一.

sentences.en: I had to bring some cohesion and unity into the company.
sentences.cn: 我得使整个公司恢复内聚力和统一.

sentences.en: I had to bring some cohesion into the company.
sentences.cn: 我得使整个公司恢复凝聚力。

sentences.en: In other words, the electric energy helps to explain the cohesion of the crystal.
sentences.cn: 换句话说, 电势能有助于解释该晶体的结合力.

sentences.en: It undermines cohesion and creates dissension.
sentences.cn: 这件事会破坏团结,制造纠纷.

sentences.en: the cohesion of the nuclear family
The shear strenth is equal to the cohesion of substance.
sentences.cn: 剪切强度等于物质的内聚力.

sentences.en: We must make China economically stronger and enhance national cohesion.
sentences.cn: 我们必须加强国力,提高民族凝聚力.

sentences.en: We were essentially agnostic about how and when political cohesion came about.
sentences.cn: 其实,我们并不想知道政治结合怎样实现,何时实现.

sentences.en: What is missing, however, is an internal, artistic cohesion.
sentences.cn: 不过，缺乏的是一种内在的艺术凝聚力。

words.tran_cn: 连贯的，一致的；明了的；清晰的；凝聚性的；互相偶合的；粘在一起的
有结合力的；紧密结合的；有粘着力的
连贯地；前后一致地；条理清楚地；互相偶合地；凝聚性地
凝聚；结合；[通信][计][力][数]内聚力

trans.tran_en: if there is cohesion among a group of people, a set of ideas etc, all the parts or members of it are connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole
